title: (x) Midcentury Font from Eichler Brochure / wide grotesque - various suggestions {gang}
content:
Can anyone tell me what the title font is on this 1950s Eichler brochure? Or something similar. Century Gothic is close but not quite right.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100302224503im_/http:/typophile.com/files/eichler-homes-brochure_4723.jpg)
  
I'm looking to use something similar in a poster that I'm gonna do up with a vintage electronics look.
author: stargazer360

comments.content:
[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/rhode/mediumextended/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100302224503/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/rhode/mediumextended/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/rhode/mediumextended/")

This is close, but the R is wrong.

Akzidenz Grotesk BQ extended is close, too, but the C is wrong. And again, the R.

[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/akzidenz-grotesk-bq/extended/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100302224503/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/akzidenz-grotesk-bq/extended/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/akzidenz-grotesk-bq/extended/")
Hey, I already own Blair! I'll go with that for now, but other suggestions are welcome, you know, for posterity.
Now, if anyone can tell me where to get a housedress like that...
